meanings.definition: A person or thing that supplies fuel.
meanings.sent1: The fuellers at the gas station keep the pumps full for customers.
meanings.sent2: The fuellers on the aircraft carrier ensure the planes have enough fuel for their missions.
meanings.sent3: The fuellers in the forest were busy gathering firewood to keep the campfire burning.
meanings.sent4: The sun can be seen as the ultimate fuellers of life on Earth, providing energy for all living things.
meanings.sent5: In the winter, the birds become the little fuellers of warmth by fluffing up their feathers for insulation.

meanings.definition: A person who operates a fuel pump.
meanings.sent1: The fuellers at the gas station help customers fill up their vehicles with gas.
meanings.sent2: The aircraft fuellers work long hours to ensure all planes are ready for takeoff.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended to be a fueller, 'filling up' her toy car with imaginary gas.
meanings.sent4: The fueller at the race track pumped gas into the high-performance cars with precision and speed.
meanings.sent5: The fueller's job requires a steady hand and good attention to detail to avoid spills.

meanings.sent1: The airplane's fuellers were checked to make sure they were securely fastened before takeoff.
meanings.sent2: The fuellers on the farm were used to store excess gasoline for the tractors.
meanings.sent3: The children used an old barrel as a fueller for their pretend spaceship, imagining it was full of rocket fuel.
meanings.sent4: The fueller on the boat was filled to the brim with diesel for the long journey ahead.
meanings.sent5: The fueller in the garage was labeled clearly to avoid any mix-ups with other liquids.
